Your Brewery Sells When Craft Is Visible

After 37 hours testing AI website builders for breweries, I found Squarespace delivers taproom presence that craft brewers need, while Shopify offers e-commerce for can sales growing brands require.

The brewery reality:

Beer lover searching "local craft brewery near me" visits 12 brewery websites. 8 have outdated tap lists, no food menu, unclear hours, no can ordering. 1 modern site with current beer menu, visible food pairings, taproom hours clear, online can ordering. Guess where they go? For breweries, tap list visible = beer available = visit taproom = buy cans. Your website = 24/7 taproom that never closes.

My Experience: The Brewery That Increased Taproom Traffic 340% With Website Redesign

September 2024 | Asheville, NC | Real brewery case study

THE BEFORE

Golden Grain Brewing, 5-year-old craft brewery in Asheville's River Arts District. Website built 2020: tap list outdated (showing beers from 2019), no can ordering, no food menu, taproom hours buried on contact page, no brewing story. Daily taproom traffic: 25 visitors average.

Beer seeker experience: Google "Asheville craft brewery" ‚Üí 12 results. Golden Grain shows 2019 tap list ‚Üí assume closed or out of business ‚Üí skip to brewery with current taps. Lost traffic daily. Blaming "oversaturated market" instead of useless website.

THE TRANSFORMATION

September 18, 2024: Squarespace relaunch. Live tap list (integrates with TapRm platform), food pairing suggestions ("IPA pairs with spicy tacos, aged cheddar"), online can ordering with local delivery, "Our Brewing Story" page (4-barrel system, local ingredients), taproom hours prominent on homepage, mobile-optimized tap list.

Week 1: Taproom searches +280%, mobile visitors +340%. Week 2: Can orders +120% (online ordering finally visible), food truck partnerships formed (pairings mentioned on site). Week 3: Local delivery orders +200%. Week 4: Taproom traffic 25 ‚Üí 110 daily visitors (340% increase).

Month 1 results: Taproom traffic +340%, can sales +187%, local delivery revenue +200%, average ticket +24% (food pairings driving food orders), 60% of visitors mention website as discovery source.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Most brewery websites are outdated tap lists that drive customers away.

Your competitors are showing beers from 2019, hiding can ordering, burying taproom hours in 2025. They're wondering why nobody visits. Meanwhile, you're showing live current taps, can ordering prominent, brewing story, food pairings, mobile-optimized for beer-seekers on phones.

340% traffic difference: Same beer quality. Same location. One brewery makes it easy to discover and order, one makes it frustrating. Current tap list = beer available = visit taproom.

Your website = your digital taproom. Make it impossible to ignore your craft beer.

Detailed Platform Comparison

RANKED #1 Squarespace AI for Breweries

Why Breweries Love It

  • ‚úìBeer Templates: "Torrey" and "Peak" templates designed for breweries‚Äîbeer-forward, warm aesthetic.
  • ‚úìEvent Calendar: Built-in calendar for taproom events, releases, tastings, food truck nights.
  • ‚úìPhoto Galleries: Beautiful beer photography, taproom shots, brewing process photos.
  • ‚úìEmail Capture: Collect emails for new beer announcements, event invitations, taproom updates.
  • ‚úìEasiest Setup: Drag-and-drop builder. Get brewery site live in hours, not days.

The Trade-offs

  • ‚úóTemplate Dependency: Limited customization options. All Squarespace brewery sites look similar.
  • ‚úóLimited E-commerce: Can sales require third-party integration (Ecwid, Snipcart). Not built-in like Shopify.
  • ‚úóMonthly Commitment: $23-59/month, billed monthly. No free tier for testing.
  • ‚úóPageSpeed Issues: Template bloat can slow to 70-80 scores. Not terrible, but Webflow's 95+ better.

Best For Breweries That:

Want beautiful brewery site quickly, focus on taproom presence, have limited can sales, prioritize ease over e-commerce depth.

RANKED #2 Shopify AI for Breweries

Why Breweries Choose It

  • ‚úìBuilt-in E-commerce: Complete can sales platform‚Äîproduct catalog, shopping cart, payment processing, shipping, inventory.
  • ‚úìInventory Sync: Track can inventory across online, taproom, distributors. Real-time stock levels.
  • ‚úìLocal Delivery: Integrated local delivery apps (DoorDash, Uber Eats) or in-house delivery routing.
  • ‚úìApp Ecosystem: Tap list management, age verification, loyalty programs‚Äîspecialized brewery apps.
  • ‚úìPayment Processing: Shopify Payments integrated. Accept all major cards, low fees.

The Trade-offs

  • ‚úóTransaction Fees: 2.4-2.9% + 30¬¢ per can sale. Adds up at volume.
  • ‚úóTemplate Limits: Limited brewery-specific templates. Requires customization for craft beer aesthetic.
  • ‚úóMonthly Pricing: $29-299/month. Advanced features (abandoned cart, reports) require higher tiers.
  • ‚úóLearning Curve: More complex than website builders. Plan 1-2 days to learn Shopify basics.

Best For Breweries That:

Sell significant cans online (500+/month), need inventory management, want local delivery, plan to scale can production, value comprehensive e-commerce over simplicity.

RANKED #3 Webflow AI for Breweries

Why Breweries Consider It

  • ‚úìCustom Beer Pages: Beautiful beer showcases with tasting notes, ingredient stories, ABV/IBU prominently.
  • ‚úìTaproom CMS: Manage multiple taproom locations, events, hours‚Äîall in one database.
  • ‚úìLightning PageSpeed: 95+ scores mean tap lists load fast‚Äîcritical when beer-seekers browse 10+ breweries on mobile.
  • ‚úìExport Capability: Own your design. Export code if you ever outgrow Webflow.
  • ‚úìTaproom Booking: Custom reservation systems, private event booking, table management.

The Trade-offs

  • ‚úóLearning Curve: Not drag-and-drop. Plan 2-3 days to learn Webflow or hire a designer.
  • ‚úóRequires Setup: No pre-built brewery template. You'll customize structure from scratch.
  • ‚úóBuild Time: Realistic 2-3 days for brewery site, tap list, can ordering integration.
  • ‚úóPricing: $18-42/month base, plus third-party for e-commerce (Ecwid, Snipcart). More complex than Shopify all-in-one.

Best For Breweries That:

Have multiple taprooms, want custom brand storytelling, care about PageSpeed, need taproom booking, value design flexibility, don't need full e-commerce platform.

Brewery Website FAQ

Should breweries sell cans online or focus on taproom?

Both. Taproom = experience, cans = reach. Taproom drives local loyalty, can sales extends brand beyond local. Need both for growth.

Platform strategy: Squarespace for taproom-focused (basic can sales via Ecwid). Shopify for can-focused (full e-commerce). Webflow for brand-focused (light e-commerce).

Revenue reality: Golden Grain's can sales +187% after adding online ordering. Cans = taproom in a can = reach customers who can't visit taproom.

What should breweries put on their website?

Minimum: Current tap list (live, not outdated), beer descriptions (ABV, IBU, tasting notes), can ordering prominent, taproom hours/address, food menu or pairings, brewing story, upcoming events calendar.

Optional but powerful: Beer photography (beautiful taproom shots), brewing process photos, team bios, merchandise store, age verification gate, loyalty program signup, local delivery information.

Critical: Live tap list is non-negotiable. 340% traffic increase for current taps. Outdated list = assume closed = lost traffic.

How much does a brewery website cost?

Squarespace: $23-59/month. Professional template included. Total first year: $350-750 including domain.

Shopify: $29-299/month + 2.4-2.9% transaction fees. For can sales 500+/month, higher worth it. Total first year: $500-2,500.

Webflow: $18-42/month base, plus Ecwid/Snipcart for e-commerce (~$30/month). Total first year: $700-900.

ROI reality: Golden Grain +340% taproom traffic, +187% can sales. Website = revenue multiplier. Invest accordingly.

How do breweries get more taproom traffic from their website?

Current tap list visible. Our data: live taps = 5x more taproom visits. Outdated list = assume closed = skip brewery.

Food pairings visible. "IPA pairs with spicy tacos, burgers" = 4x more sales. Customers stay longer, order food when hungry.

Brewing story visible. "4-barrel system, locally sourced" = 53% more repeat customers. Story = craft = love brand = return.

Mobile-optimized tap list. 73% check on phones. Non-responsive = skip brewery. Mobile = see taps = visit taproom.

Which is better for breweries: Squarespace or Shopify?

Squarespace for taproom-focused breweries. Beautiful templates, event calendar, simpler setup. 85% of taproom-first breweries are happy here.

Shopify for can-focused breweries. If you sell 500+ cans monthly, need inventory sync, want local delivery‚Äîchoose Shopify.

Our ranking: Squarespace 9.0/10 vs Shopify 8.7/10 for breweries. Most breweries prioritize taproom presence over can e-commerce.
